#labels Featured,Installation
= Installation =

Robotframework Eclipse Library from v0.12 now works on :
 * robotframework v2.5.3
 * python v2.6
 * jython v2.5.1
 * RIDE v0.27
 * Eclipse 3.5 and 3.6 (should work also on 3.4 but not tested!)
 * SWTBot 2.0
 * Javalib core 0.8.1 with dependencies

== Eclipse Plugin ==
 Before using Eclipse Library, you should install a plugin under Eclipse.
 * Robotframework Eclipse Library plugin for SWTBot update site
   `http://scrumvision.sourceforge.net/update-site/eclipselibrary`
 
 This plugin will ask you installing SWTBot normaly.
 * if not, SWTBot plugins should be installed from 
  * SWTBot  update site for Eclipse 3.5 : `http://download.eclipse.org/technology/swtbot/galileo/dev-build/update-site`
  * SWTBot update site for Eclipse 3.6 : `http://download.eclipse.org/technology/swtbot/helios/dev-build/update-site`

 
== Eclipse library ==
 Download the latest eclipse library jar file.
 * The jar with all dependencies [http://code.google.com/p/robotframework-eclipselibrary/downloads/list eclipselibrary-x.x-with-dependencies.jar]
OR
 * The `EclipseLibrary` [http://code.google.com/p/robotframework-eclipselibrary/downloads/list eclipselibrary-x.x.jar]
 * The `JavalibCore`  [http://code.google.com/p/robotframework-javatools/downloads/list javalib-core-x.x.x-jar-with-dependencies.jar]
 * The Eclipse Equinox launcher (like `org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.201.R35x_v20090715.jar`) that you should find under eclipse installation folder, under plugins
Place files in 'lib' folder under your test suite

 Download the eclipsebot.bat (or run.py) robotframework script for Eclipse tests
 * [http://robotframework-eclipselibrary.googlecode.com/files/eclipsebot.bat eclipsebot.bat]
 * [http://robotframework-eclipselibrary.googlecode.com/files/run.py run.py] python is now updated for PermGen jvm option

 Add Eclipse Library resource file in your test case as a resource.
 * [http://robotframework-eclipselibrary.googlecode.com/files/EclipseLibraryKeywords.html  EclipseLibraryKeywords.html]

 Add Eclipse Library xml keyword specification file under PYTHON_PATH for keyword completion under RIDE
 * [http://robotframework-eclipselibrary.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/org.lcx.robotframework.eclipselibrary-testcases/documentation/EclipseLibrary.xml  EclipseLibrary.xml]

== Running with Eclipse ==
 Test your installation
 * Download [http://robotframework-eclipselibrary.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/org.lcx.robotframework.eclipselibrary-testcases/A_TestEclipseLibrary_installation.html installation test case]
 * Then launch in console : `eclipsebot.bat A_TestEclipseLibrary_installation.html`
 * or `run.py A_TestEclipseLibrary_installation.html`

 Eclipse may throw a `PermGen error` or `OutOfMemory` exception.
 * It is then better to use [http://code.google.com/p/robotframework/wiki/JavaIntegration robotframework standalone jar] and set following parameters to the java command (eclipsebot.bat) :
{{{
@echo off
set ECLIPSE_LIBRARY=lib/eclipselibrary-0.11-with-dependencies.jar
set ROBOTFRAMEWORK=robotframework-2.5.4.1.jar
java -Xms256m -Xmx512m -XX:PermSize=64M -XX:MaxPermSize=256M  -Xbootclasspath/a:%ECLIPSE_LIBRARY% -jar  %ROBOTFRAMEWORK% --debugfile jybot.log --loglevel TRACE --outputdir results %* 
}}}
 * eclipsebot --suite `TestPerspectiveAndView` `TestSamples`
